noun.description: A tide just after the first or third quarters of the moon when there is least difference between high and low water.
examples: neaps occur at 6 a.m. and 6 p.m.

verb.description: (of a boat) be kept aground or in harbor by a neap tide.
examples: a change of wind could leave you neaped

origin: Late Middle English, originally an adjective from Old English nēp, first element of nēpflōd neap flood, of unknown origin.
